Forms

  • Usage guidelines
  • Basic form
  • Input field
  • Checkbox
  • Radio button
  • Toggle
  • Select menu
  • Textarea
  • Error message
  • Alternate error markup

Usage Guidelines

Forms are a grouping of data input fields and controls into which the user can enter data. Forms can be used for a variety of cases, but the one constant is that they require the user to enter input and then submit it to the system for processing. Forms can appear on their own or inside another component, like a sidebar or modal. Forms should follow a logical flow based upon the task at hand and the kind of information required to complete it.

Do

  • Organize forms in one column
  • Group related information (e.g. personal, account, contact)
  • Align labels with the top of controls
  • Use appropriate type attribute (e.g. email, tel, number) to enable mobile-friendly input (reference)

Don't

  • Use form controls outside of a form (e.g. checkbox, radio button, input field)
  • Use placeholder text as labels
  • Make labels ALL-CAPS

Basic form

Use forms to collect information from users, such as contact information, status updates, or credentials.

Input field

Checkbox

A checkbox allows users to choose one or more values from a group of related options. Use the checked attribute to pre-select a value and disabled to disable an option.

Radio button

Radio buttons allow users to choose a single value from between 2 to 5 options. Use the checked attribute to pre-select a value and disabled to disable an option.

Toggle

The toggle control is a restyled version of the radio control and behaves the same way. Use it to allow users to choose a single value when there are 2 to 5 options available.

Select menu

Select menus allow users to choose a single value from a list of 6-25 options. If more options are needed, like a list of countries or states, use a simple search control with dropdown results.

Textarea

The textarea element is used for collecting long blocks of input from the user, like a comments field or long description.

Error message

Give users inline visual feedback to indicate the status of their input.

Please enter a valid email address

Alternate error markup

In cases where the validation state class needs to be applied diretly to the input control, use this modified markup.

Please enter a valid email address.
